data.text: @emilygraymd_mph @Opinionater2021 @Loretta_Torrago right I remember reading that before the pandemic the typical average ICU stay was far shorter than with covid patients on average

@Opinionater2021 @Loretta_Torrago @watermelonpunch If they stay long enough, in some (or all?) places, they become post-covid. Plus, the criteria especially looks at "new" admits so doesn't account for already existing admissions that need care and "use up" capacity.

@HughThunkIt Yes. There will be exceptions, but, for the most part, they know exactly who will die and they are fine with that so yes, very Tuskegee. I am not aware if downwinders were, as a rule, either minorities or poor though I am very aware they were all human beings who deserved better.

@Loretta_Torrago @Lujan588 Yes, it's a good explanation of that particular bit of statistical sophistry. And it's important to note that it is just the latest in a series of statistical misrepresentations and outright lies ("breakthrough infections are extremely rareâ„¢") intended to mislead the public.

@Loretta_Torrago I find it criminal, in a Tuskegee experiment or Nevada downwind nuclear test sort of way, that the White House and CDC groomed vaccinated citizens to eschew masks or testing (unless symptomatic), when they knew (1) breakthroughs were causing serious harm, and (2) Delta was coming https://t.co/V9K765ZxM7
@Loretta_Torrago @sachapie And I am so sorry about your mom.
@Loretta_Torrago @sachapie Best wishes to you, also. It's so sad that they just can't be honest for the vulnerable so they can be cautious.

@Loretta_Torrago It mostly pisses me off for others since a lot of people aren't paying attention. I am super paying attention and learned long ago don't go by anything government (Fed. and local) is telling me Covid safety wise.
